data.title: 'Nobel Laureates in Literature: Samuel Beckett' Quiz
data.meta_description: A Literature > Authors Quiz : One of the world's most prestigious and coveted recognitions is the Nobel Prize, which recognizes individuals and organizations who have made significant contributions in one of six categories: Physics, Chemistry, Medicine, Literature, Peace,...
data.text:
Question #1

In what year was Beckett awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature "for his writing, which - in new forms for the novel and drama - in the destitution of modern man acquires its elevation"?

1959

1969

1979

1989

Question #2

Beckett was born in Dublin, Ireland in the year 1906, on the same day that _____ was celebrated.

Ash Wednesday

Good Friday

Easter Sunday

Saint Patrick's Day

Question #3

Which of the following novels was not a work by Beckett?

How It Is

Malone Dies

A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

Mercier and Camier

Question #4

Beckett concluded his Nobel Prize acceptance speech with the line, "The perception of human degradation - which we have witnessed, perhaps, to a greater extent than any previous generation - is not possible if human values are denied."

True

False

Question #5

In 1938, Beckett was stabbed in the streets of Paris by a man who had asked him for some money. Beckett was hospitalized for a perforated lung, but afterwards visited the man in prison and asked him why he had attacked Beckett. The man replied:

"Je ne peux pas vous dire maintenant." ("I cannot tell you now.")

"Parce que vous ne m'avez pas donn√© d'argent." ("Because you did not give me any money.")

"Je ne sais pas, Monsieur." ("I do not know, sir.")

"Ce n'est pas important, Monsieur." ("That is not important, sir.")

Question #6

Which of Beckett's plays features characters such as Estragon, Vladimir, Lucky, and Pozzo?

All Strange Away

Endgame

Happy Days

Waiting for Godot

Question #7

During World War II, Beckett joined a resistance movement in England, but was forced to flee for his life and to seek refuge in Ireland.

True

False

Question #8

"The sun shone, having no alternative, on the nothing new" is the first line to which one of Beckett's novels?

Murphy

Dream of Fair to Middling Women

The Unnamable

Watt

Question #9

In what year did Beckett receive an honorary doctorate from Trinity College in Dublin, Ireland?

1939

1949

1959

1969
